Linking to BaseTen and BaseTenAppKit

Mac OS X's linker specifies paths to dynamic libraries (including frameworks) using a the install name of the library. The install name is specified in the library itself. BaseTen and BaseTenAppKit distributed on the disk image have their install names set to a location inside the loading application's bundle, in the Frameworks folder. When linking to the frameworks in Xcode, a Copy Files build phase should be added for the application target:

  1. Right-click your application target in the Groups & Files table
  2. Select Add, New Build Phase and New Copy Files Build Phase
  3. Select Frameworks as the destination
  4. Click the disclosure triangle next to your target
  5. Drag BaseTen and BaseTenAppKit inside the new build phase

The frameworks are built with the -headerpad_max_install_names linker option, so changing the install names with tools like install_name_tool should also be possible. When building BaseTen and BaseTenAppKit using the Debug configuration, the install name is left empty, which causes it to be set to the build directory.
